segments.text: As a matter of fact, the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Honey, you knew there was nothing in that.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I knew nothing of the sort.  You took presents from him.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Presents?  Just a trivial little broach.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Ah, yes, I remember it well.  Bristling with diamonds in the worst possible taste.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No, it wasn't.  It was very pretty.  I still have it and I wear it often.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You went out of your way to torture me over Peter Burden.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No, I didn't.  You worked the whole thing up in your jealous imagination.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You must admit, he was in love with you, wasn't he?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Just a little perhaps, nothing serious.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You let him kiss you.  You said you did.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well, what of it?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What of it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It didn't hurt him at all and I enjoyed it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well, what about me?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well, if you hadn't been so suspicious and nosey, you never would have known a thing about it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well, that's a nice point of view I must say.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I'm bored with this conversation.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Me, too.  Bored stiff.  You want some brandy?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No, thanks.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I think I'll have some.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Don't see why you want any.  You've already had two glasses.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No particular reason.  Anyhow they were very small ones.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Just seems so silly to go on and on and on with such a thing.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You can hardly call three liquor glasses in a whole evening going on and on and on.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well, it's become a habit with you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You needn't be so grand, just because you don't happen to want any yourself at the moment.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Don't be so stupid.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Really, Amanda.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Nothing.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Going out somewhere dear?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No, just making myself fascinating for you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: That reply has broken my heart.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: A woman's job is to allure the man.  Watch me a minute, will you?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: As a matter of fact, that's perfectly true.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No, it isn't.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yes, it is.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh, be quiet.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Ah, it's a pity you didn't have any more brandy.  It might have made you a little less disagreeable.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Doesn't seem to have worked such wonders with you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Snap, snap, snap, like a little adder.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Adders don't snap, they sting.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Nonsense.  They have a little bag of venom behind their fangs and they snap.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: They sting.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: They snap.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't care, do you understand?  I don't care.  I don't care if they bark or roll about like hoops.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Did you see much of Peter Burden after our divorce?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yes, I did.  Quite a lot.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Hmm, I imagine you let him kiss you a good deal more then.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Mind your own business.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh, must have had a riotous time. No restraint at all.  Very enjoyable and never had much anyhow.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You're quite insufferable
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I expect it's because you're drunk.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I'm not in the least drunk.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You've always had a weak head.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: As I mentioned before, I have had three minute liquor glasses of brandy the whole evening long.  A child of two couldn't get drunk on that.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: On the contrary, a child of two could get violently drunk on only one glass of brandy.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh, very interesting.  How about a child of four?  A child of six?  Or a child of nine?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Shut up.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: We could get a good debate going about this, don't you think?  Intemperate tots.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Not very funny, dear.  You'd better have some more brandy.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: All right.  I will.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You better turn that off, I think.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Why?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Because it's late and it'll annoy the people upstairs.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: There aren't any people upstairs.  It's a photographer's studio.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: There are people downstairs I suppose?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: They're away in Tunis.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: This is no time of the year for Tunis.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Turn it on again, please.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I'll do no such thing.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Very well, if you insist on being boorish and idiotic.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Turn it off.  It's driving me mad.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You are far too temperamental.  Try to control yourself.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Turn it off.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Stop it.  Go away.  I hate you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Amanda, listen. listen
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Listen?  Listen, indeed.  I am sick and tired of listening to you, damn sadistic bully.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Very amusing, indeed.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I hate you.  Stop it.  Stop it.  I hate you, do you hear?  You're conceited and overbearing and utterly impossible.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You're a vile, tempered, loose living, wicked little beast and I hope to never see you again as long as I live.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: This is the end.  Finally and forever.  Do you hear me?  The end.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You're not going like this.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh Yes, I am.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You're not.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I am.  Let go of me.  You're a cruel fiend and I hate and loathe you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Shut up. Shut up.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I wouldn't-- I wouldn't marry--
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I wouldn't marry you if you came in crawling on your knees
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Thank God I realized what you are-- I'd never marry you again ever in my life. You're a cruel fiend and I hate you. You're a beast. You're a beast--I hate you. Stop it.  Stop it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You're a evil vampire and I hope to God I never see you again as long as I live.
segments.speaker: M
